alert.note: Alert for Bienville; De Soto; Natchitoches; Red River; Sabine (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 26 at 4:16PM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern De Soto, Red River, northwestern Natchitoches, southwestern Bienville and northwestern Sabine Parishes through 515 PM CDT... At 416 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Mansfield, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Mansfield, Coushatta, Ringgold, Martin, Goldonna, South Mansfield, Hall Summit, Saline, Lucky, Ashland, Castor, Grand Cane, Edgefield, Jamestown, Stanley, Carmel, Grand Bayou, Hanna, Loggy Bayou and Pelican. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 PM CDT for northwestern Louisiana.

area.areaDesc: Bienville; De Soto; Natchitoches; Red River; Sabine
